attributes.action: hold a referendum in England to ask the English taxpayer if they are prepared to continue funding the position of Scotland as part of the Union.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: On 7 March 2007 Tony bliar bragged in the House of Commons that every resident north of the border received more than TWO THOUSAND POUNDS more from central government than they paid in as taxpayers.  This is money which has been taken from english taxpayers and it is money which we can no longer afford to continue paying.  The May elections are seen as an opportunity for the Scottish to say if they wish to continue as a part of the Union.  The English taxpayer is entitled to decide whether or not we wish to continue to have them in the Union!
